article:
'Londa Schiebinger' is a historian of science specialising in research on the
relationship between gender and science. She is the John L. Hinds Professor of
History of Science, [http://www.stanford.edu/dept/HPS/schiebinger.html Londa
Schiebinger], The Program in History and Philosophy of Science and Technology at
Stanford University and the Barbara D. Finberg Director of the Michelle R.
Clayman Institute for Gender Research at Stanford
University. [http://www.stanford.edu/group/gender/People/Director.html
Director], Michelle R. Clayman Institute for Gender Research

She graduated from University of Nebraska with a B.A. in English in 1974, from
Harvard University with a M.A. in History in 1977, and with a Ph.D. in History
in 1984. [http://www.stanford.edu/dept/HPST/schiebinger.html Londa
Schiebinger] biography at Stanford University

She works on gendered innovations in science, medicine, and engineering, where
she and her team explore how gender analysis, when turned to science and
technology, can spark creativity by opening new questions and fields for future
research. [http://multi.stanford.edu/interaction/0208/gender.html Gender: A
Fiercely Interdisciplinary Terrain], Interaction, Winter 2008, Stanford
University She lectured at the University of Oldenburg, http://www.zfg.uni-
oldenburg.de/docs/schiebinger1.pdf and the Adelaide Festival of
Ideas.
categories: Stanford University Department of History faculty
